subject: Investing
title: The Case for International Diversification
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Case for International Diversification.

hook.text: US stocks dominated the 2010s. In the 2000s, emerging markets tripled while the S&P 500 went nowhere.

buildup.text: No single country leads forever. Market leadership rotates across regions in multi-year cycles.

discovery.text: International diversification reduces portfolio risk because different economies peak at different times.

twist.text: Home bias is real: Americans hold 70% domestic stocks despite the US being only 60% of world market cap.

climax.text: Adding even 20-30% international exposure historically improved risk-adjusted returns over full market cycles.

punchline.text: The world is bigger than Wall Street. Your portfolio should reflect that.

quiz.question: Why does international diversification improve portfolios?
options: Different economies peak at different times
